beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Nicolet Hot Days? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Nicolet Hot Days scored 40 out of 100. Grassroots tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.text_on_screen: Should You Race Nicolet Hot Days?
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Nicolet Hot Days. Wabeno, Wisconsin. 50 mi. Wisconsin rolling gravel.
beats.text_on_screen: Nicolet Hot Days | Wabeno, Wisconsin | 50 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Fourteen dimensions. Here's where it lands. Value. 4 out of 5. Strong value proposition. Free entry for two days of guided adventure through Nicolet National Forest, including planned dinner and drinks stops, delivers exceptional value. Expenses. 3 out of 5. Mid-range expenses. Budget a proper race weekend. Logistics. 2 out of 5. Functional. Not impressive. Length. 2 out of 5. Won't destroy your week. The 50-mile distance sits in middle ground - substantial enough to matter but not epic. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Some chunky bits. Nothing catastrophic. Mix of fast gravel and rough fire lanes with some ATV trails and optional singletrack through Nicolet forest. Elevation. 2 out of 5. A few hills. Nothing to lose sleep over. The 2500 feet of climbing over 50 miles through Wisconsin's glacial terrain provides steady rolling effort without epic mountain suffering. Climate. 2 out of 5. Mild conditions. Nothing dramatic. Mid-August timing lives up to the 'Hot Days' name. Adventure. 2 out of 5. Mild adventure. Scenic ride with a number plate. The route requires fording a waist-deep river and camping at remote National Forest spots without facilities.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: And the rest of the scorecard. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Basic but functional. Gets the job done. Experience. 2 out of 5. Pleasant enough. Won't change your life. Community. 2 out of 5. Some community spirit. Nothing organized. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Sea level. Your lungs get a day off. Prestige. 1 out of 5. Nobody at the coffee shop will recognize this name. Field Depth. 1 out of 5. Not exactly stacked.
